title: Safer Juice - Part 5 - Agriculture Practices and Raw Materials

tasks.task: Conducting a risk analysis of microbial contamination in fresh fruit and vegetable juices.
subtasks: Identifying potential sources of microbial contamination during production, harvesting, packing, and transportation.
Understanding the role of soil and water quality in minimizing contamination.
Ensuring proper handling and application of manure as fertilizer.
Managing irrigation water and other water sources used in crop production.
Maintaining hygiene and sanitation practices among workers and transport vehicles.
Implementing pest control measures to prevent contamination from insects and other pests.
Documenting the source of raw materials and maintaining detailed records for traceability.

tasks.task: Ensuring the safety and quality of raw materials used in juice production.
subtasks: Verifying the cleanliness and safety of containers used for transportation.
Monitoring water quality and its use in contact with produce.
Properly fertilizing crops with well-composted manure and adhering to waiting periods.
Protecting fields from potential contamination sources such as nearby livestock and manure storage facilities.
Implementing good agricultural and manufacturing practices to minimize microbial hazards.

tasks.task: Minimizing microbial contamination at the farm level during the growth and harvest of produce.
subtasks: Practicing worker hygiene and sanitation during production, harvesting, sorting, packing, and transport.
Ensuring proper sanitation of facilities, equipment, and containers used in packing houses.
Managing the cooling and storage of produce to prevent microbial growth.
Transporting produce under sanitary conditions to minimize cross-contamination.
Regularly testing water quality and using appropriate antimicrobial treatments when necessary.
Properly washing and rinsing produce to remove surface contaminants.

tasks.task: Evaluating the overall effectiveness of agricultural and manufacturing practices to ensure food safety.
subtasks: Conducting microbial testing of produce and water samples.
Regularly inspecting packing facilities for contamination sources and addressing any issues.
Training workers on proper hygiene practices and the handling of produce.
Monitoring and adhering to proper chemical usage, including pesticides and fertilizers.
Developing and enforcing grower agreements to ensure adherence to food safety standards.

tasks.task: Understanding and enforcing legal and regulatory requirements in agricultural practices.
subtasks: Complying with national and international food safety guidelines and standards.
Adhering to local, state, and federal laws governing agricultural practices and food safety.
